thread.title: Arum prefers Broner, Crawford over Khan for Pacquiao
thread.title_full: Arum prefers Broner, Crawford over Khan for Pacquiao

title: Arum prefers Broner, Crawford over Khan for Pacquiao
text:
Arum prefers Broner, Crawford over Khan for Pacquiao By Dino Maragay (Associated Press)   3:01pm Adrien Broner and Terence Crawford 
MANILA, Philippines – British fighter Amir Khan is nowhere in Bob Arum’s radar as a future opponent for Manny Pacquiao. 
After a reported deal for a May fight between Pacquiao and Khan fell through, Arum had said the two could face each other in November instead. 
But now, the veteran promoter thinks there are other more marketable opponents than Khan. 
In a boxingscene.com report, Arum said he does not see a Pacquiao-Khan bout happening later this year, instead preferring the Filipino icon to take on either former champion Adrien Broner or rising star Terence Crawford. 
"No, not really [will the fight with Khan happen in the fall], because I think that when we come to November, I think that there are other candidates that would probably do a lot better, particularly on US pay-per-view, like either Adrien Broner or Terence Crawford," Arum explained. 
Khan hasn’t fought since getting knocked out by Saul Alvarez when the former challenged the latter in a middleweight title fight in May last year.   
In contrast, Broner (33-2, with 24 KOs) and Crawford (30-0, with 21 KOs) have been more active and are both coming off wins, which may have led Arum to conclude that the two are more marketable on pay-per-view. 
"Guys like that, who probably have more credibility at this point, in this country, than Amir Khan does," Arum added. 
Jeff Horn, whose representatives had earlier negotiated with Arum for a shot at Pacquiao, remains in the mix. 
"If the fight is going to be in Australia, then it probably will be Jeff Horn. If it's somewhere else, then it may not be. We are probably targeting sometime in July now, when the Philippine Senate will be once again in recess," Arum said.
